headline: Wall Street’s Good Times Roll While the Rest of the Economy Plods Along
summary: The latest wave of big U.S. banks’ financial results revealed that Wall Street traders, investment bankers, and wealth managers who cater to affluent clients turned in a banner year.  For everyday consumers, though, the big lenders’ reports presented a different picture: good, not great.  The four largest U.S. banks—  JPMorgan Chase Bank of America Wells Fargo  and  Citigroup  —and the investment banks  Goldman Sachs  and  Morgan Stanley  reported solid fourth-quarter earnings this week.

raw.headline: Wall Street’s Good Times Roll While the Rest of the Economy Plods Along
raw.summary: The latest wave of big U.S. banks’ financial results revealed that Wall Street traders, investment bankers, and wealth managers who cater to affluent clients turned in a banner year.  For everyday consumers, though, the big lenders’ reports presented a different picture: good, not great.  The four largest U.S. banks—  JPMorgan Chase Bank of America Wells Fargo  and  Citigroup  —and the investment banks  Goldman Sachs  and  Morgan Stanley  reported solid fourth-quarter earnings this week.

headline: BofA (BAC) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Thank you for joining us to review our fourth quarter results.  During the quarter, we elected to change the accounting method related to our tax-related equity investments in order to better align our financial statement presentation with the economic and financial impact of those investments.  The primary impact of the accounting change was a reclassification between the income statement line items in our income statement, which had an insignificant impact on net income.

raw.headline: BofA (BAC) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
raw.summary: Thank you for joining us to review our fourth quarter results.  During the quarter, we elected to change the accounting method related to our tax-related equity investments in order to better align our financial statement presentation with the economic and financial impact of those investments.  The primary impact of the accounting change was a reclassification between the income statement line items in our income statement, which had an insignificant impact on net income.

headline: Morgan Stanley Rakes in New Assets as It Rides Bull Market for Stocks
summary: Morgan Stanley’s wealth management unit has been riding a bull market for equities that has enticed investors to add billions of dollars to their accounts and buy stocks.  Morgan Stanley's wealth unit reported record net revenue of $31.8 billion for the full year.  The company is one of the nation’s largest wealth managers, with thousands of financial advisors and online brokerage E*Trade.

headline: BAC Q4 Deep Dive: Revenue Growth and Strategic Investment Offset by Expense Concerns
summary: Financial services giant Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) reported Q4 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 7.1% year on year to $28.53 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.98 per share was 2.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
